Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel, avoid Room 101!”
Reviews.Author: Rich J
Reviews.Content: Like the previous reviewer, we've just returned from a 3-night stay...in room 101. Room 101 is dingy, dark and tomb-like....and noisy, because it's immediately adjacent to the communal areas of the hotel. From 6 am onward you can hear the cleaning/crockery clattering and whatever else is going on right outside the door. The darkness of the room (it's almost a basement, with next to no natural light) really depressed us. The good stuff...the rest of the hotel was quite charming with it's dated, 'Orient-express' decor. The bar was very reasonable - the cheapest drinks anywhere - but yes it did close at 9.30 so a nightcap was out of the question. Breakfast was quite good - actually much more varied than most continental style breakfasts. The staff were quite nice. While the location is not great, barely 30seconds walk away was 'Ristorante Africa' - a cosy North African/Middle Eastern style place which served excellent mezze-style food, apart from the wierd flatbreads. We really liked it there, and it was very busy after 8.30pm. Overall, we would stay here again, but would insist on an upper floor room. However, I don't understand the 2 Euro pp per/day add on....

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Firefox26
Reviews.Content: This hotel should be a 4 star. We had a room on the 2nd floor and it had a bath big enough to fit two people in. The staff were great to so helpful and happy! Over all it was a great trip to Roma and I would go back to this hotel tomorrow if I could!!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: KevinPlymouth
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a 4night stay at this hotel and I must say I was disappointed. My wife and I selected the hotel based on the reviews found on this site, but what we found was not as had been described. We traveled with friends and were allocated rooms 101 and 103. It's possible other rooms in the hotel are better but I can only review what I saw. Both rooms were clean but in poor condition. The rooms were small and the shower room tiny. The door on the shower was held together with insulating tape and the tiles were badly cracked. There were wooden shelves fitted in the bathroom beside the shower which made it difficult for an adult to access the shower without scrapping ones back against the shelves. The bedroom had a bad smell of drains which meant we had to leave our window open at all times, luckily there were shutters on the outside as a security measure. Our friends in the next room had the same problem. There were twin beds but the bases were 3' but they had 2'6" mattresses. No duvet I'm afraid. The furniture is dated and tatty. There is a charge of 18Euro a day for the TV etc. On checkout there is a tax charged of 2Euro per person per day. Breakfast was good as long as your happy with continental style. The staff were pleasant enough. Tea and coffee making facilities at this hotel equals a kettle, when I enquired about tea and coffee the person on reception laughed and directed me to the supermarket. The bar prices are reasonable but it does close at 21:30. Location is convenient for the Termini(bus & train) but there is a limited choice of eateries in the area. If visiting Rome for more than two days I would recommend purchasing a Roma Pass from the tourist information office, this pass will give give entry to some major attractions and bus and metro travel. You will recover the cost in entry fees alone. You will be offered a hop-on / hop-off bus as an alternative by street sellers I would not recommend purchasing them. These buses are expensive and most of the sites are within walking distance of one another. There is an airport shuttle bus every 30 minutes for 6 Euro each way which takes approximately an hour journey time.

Reviews.Title: “Over rated”
Reviews.Author: clareandjamie
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the hotel Andreotti in March for a long weekend to celebrate our wedding anniversary. After reading some of the reviews on Trip advisor we were expecting great things from the hotel. We arrived at 11.30 in the morning and found the hotel with ease. It is round the corner from the main terminal station in Rome. We checked in with no problem and were given a slight upgrade on the room which was nice. The lady that checked us in was polite and gave us a map and information on trips. Our room was clean and comfortable. The bathroom was new and the room was a good size. To be honest we came to Rome to see Rome and not spend time in the room. After getting changed we went out for the day and had a wonderful time. Upon returning to the Hotel that evening we decided to have a couple of drinks in the bar - However, no-one was available to serve us as the barman we busy tiling in a bedroom. We asked at reception if they could call us in our room once the barman was ready and were told 10 minutes. However 30 minutes later my husband went back to reception and then they got someone to serve us. Anyway we didn't mind too much - We were on Holiday after all! The next morning we went to breakfast and it was pretty poor. There was no hot food and the cold selection was rice with peas, garlic ham, bread (that you couldn't toast because the toaster didn't work) rock hard croissants or yoghurt. There was tea - but the water was warm not hot and juice which was okay. I usually do not moan about food (please see my other reviews) but this was particualy poor for Italy and a 3 star hotel! The facilities at the hotel were dated and or did not work. The bar area was very small and dated. We met some other guests in the hotel and enjoyed a drink in the bar - However, the staff were rude and kept asking us to be quiet. Not great service! We tried to use the internet to check in for our return flight - but the screen didn't work and when the man at reception went to find out how to fix it - he just started checking people in and forgot about us! And at 3 euro for 30 minutes its not cheap! The lift was very old and I was a bit worried if it was safe or not. Apart from 1 broken computer, a small bar area and a tiny breakfast room - There was no other facilities to speak of. Overall I would recommend Rome but not this Hotel. The hotel is in a great location and could be a fantastic place to stay but It really needs an update - Not just on the décor but also the staff and facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Unusual Decor but clean and excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: AramisTonks
Reviews.Content: Our room was decorated with soft cloth dark blue floral wallpaper, walls and ceiling with dark purple curtains and a very dark bed spread! without the feeble light from the single bulb it was incredibly dark. though a bit apprehensive at first, the dark room made for an amazing nights sleep, warm, quiet dark and very cosy! Food was good, though we only had breakfast at the Drotti as it is well connected with the city, there are two fairly local tube stops to the hotel within a few hundred meters and it's well within walking distance from the main termini. Overall it was an excellent choice and one which served us well on our four day stay in Rome. Oh and there was a huge mirror above the bed too...

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: cathymaker
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights and the place was fantastic compared with the Medici in Via Flavia where we stayed a few years ago - the main difference being the attitude of the staff who were all really friendly, (as opposed to not friendly in the case of Medici which was a nice enough looking hotel but not at all welcoming). But as well as the friendly staff, the breakfast was great, the rooms lovely - though a bit on the small side for 2 sharing I think - and clean, and location just about perfect. Only slight surprise was the bar closing so early in the evening but maybe that was a good thing as I soon found the prosecco in the mini bar was excellent and didn't cost a lot!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely friendly and centrally located hotel”
Reviews.Author: upeteri
Reviews.Content: A real gem of a find particualarly if you get a 3 nights for 2 deal! Comfortable and great staff, good breakfast and great location. Rooms are small as is usual for Rome but beds very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Central 3* with classy decor .”
Reviews.Author: 643amc
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel , as it is only 300 metres from Termini train and bus station . Good points ...many ...Friendly reception and staff, well sized room with clothes press and lcd TV with many stations . A central lift out of a 1940s movie, that worked perfectly , even if 4 get cramped to use it . Good breakfast with lots of choice , internet connections in the room as well as pay TV. Wonderful decor in the lobby area and bar with piano and period furniture all around ....great photoshots for the album ! Small bad points ....nothing to be worried about if fully mobile . New sheets and towels everyday , plus a chocolate sweet on every bedside table every day makes you feel pampered ....great PR ! Now come the bad points ! The hotel has 6 steps up into the reception area and may not be easily accessable to anyone with a walking problem. I can be corrected on this , but I did not see a ramp or chairlift. As with all Rome 3* hotels , the bathroom is on the small side , but even with my large size , I was well suited and can only say that the toilet seat is a bit cramped. I would recommend this hotel to my friends as the staff are helpful and everything is kept very clean. Breakfast is continental and well served , with hot coffee and tea machine and fruit juice dispensing machine. Careful of the pickpockets on bus 64 and at Termini station , wear your valuables in a zipped pocket and under your clothes ...you will not be the first to lose your wallet ! Keep your plastic credit cards separate and a wallet with little change and a few notes for everyday use , other cas well hidden away ! You have been warned of Rome pickpockets !

Reviews.Title: “GOOD CITY HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: LOVEPRINCEANDTRAVEL
Reviews.Content: My husband and I, enjoyed our 4 night break, at this hotel. We were very impressed with the appearance in the lobby area, sitting room and breakfast room. Lovely period furniture, decor and flowers. The breakfast room is clean and well presented, serving a tasty continental breakfast, with plenty of choice. Our room (period style decor), was clean and comfortable. The bathroom was modern-ish, just a few little complaints. The walk in shower door was broken, and kept opening during the shower (to be fair, we did overlook reporting it, room 210) The bathroom was very small, and so the toilet was rather awkward to get to, and too close to the sink. These were minor things, so the good, outweighed the bad ! They do supply shower gel etc, presented in a nice box. Small irritant, is that we could not get any English channels on TV, not even the usual news channel ? I don't know if we were doing something wrong ? Nice to have something on, first thing, and late evening ! The position of the hotel is excellent. About 5 minutes to the Termini, to get trains and buses (including the hop on / off tourist buses). Also coaches, serving both airports. Turn left out of the hotel, and a few yards up the road, for the nearest chemist. There are quite a few restaurants near the hotel. We loved Rome, so much to see and do (but very expensive !!) We would stay at this hotel again. WARNING....beware of pick pockets ! They work in pairs or groups. They approach you, begging for money, using a a folding piece of cardboard. While one is talking, the other goes behind, they use the cardboard, to hold near the bag etc, while the other hand is under it, undoing the zips etc. They are very persistant ! Luckily, my husband spotted it, shouted at them, and they left, empty handed. This happened to us, as we were leaving the wonderful City. I know that it can happen in any City, so don't let it put you off going, just be aware ! Overall, we felt very safe walking around, even in the evenings !! Thank you to the hotel staff, for an enjoyable stay !

Reviews.Title: “the wonderful andreotti”
Reviews.Author: Mike O
Reviews.Content: Just returned back from a 4 night stay at the wonderful andreotti hotel, March 2012. The hotel was beautiful, staff was very friendly. The breakfast was continental but there was plenty to choose from. Location was ideal it was a 5 min walk from the bus and train station. Just like to thank all the staff at the Andreotti for a fabulous stay, we will be hoping to return shortly.

Reviews.Title: “Clean & comfortable”
Reviews.Author: AD1973
Reviews.Content: Clean and comfortable hotel in a good location near to Termini Station. Breakfast was ok, lots of choice of pastries, cakes and cereal. Staff were helpful. Bar prices were reasonable. Room was in need of a refurb.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value, Nice Staff, Central Location”
Reviews.Author: NathanGunn
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights in Feb 2012. Room was nice a little rough round the edges (lose toilet roll holder) but very clean. Its about 5 minute walk from Termi station. Breakfast OK with a selection of meats, bread and cheese. Cappuccino and fresh juice is included. Check in and check out was friendly and quick. Overall a good hotel for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and charming hotel”
Reviews.Author: ChanHK
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for 2 separate dates (after travelling from Siena and travelling from Naples) in January 2012. We booked a twin room and a single room and were assigned in the same floor as our requested. The location is good as it locates near the Roma Termini Station (8 mins on foot, via Marsala Exit from the Roma Termini Station). The rooms are clean and are decorated in an elegant style and charming. All staff in the hotel is nice and helpful. As we first stayed for one day before approaching to Naples, the hotel receptionist allowed us to leave our big luggages in the hotel storeroom for two nights. After travelling from Naples, we stayed one more night in this hotel again. One strange thing we encountered is that the hotel receptionist required us to present our passports and register our information again when we check-in after travelling from Naples. After we settled down our luggages in the room, we asked for our passports back but the receptionist told us that he has not yet completed the registration and he said he can only return back our passport after 2-3 hours. It seems to be nonsense if we don’t possess our identified documentation in Roma being a tourist. On the other hand, we need original passports for tax refund purpose. We then strongly requested to have the return back of our original passports. The breakfast is perfect, there are many choices of bread, croissants, cheese, eggs, ham, cakes, milk, yogurt, fresh fruits, hot dishes and juices, etc. You can also make your own coffee & tea from the machine. Free wifi in the room and entire hotel. If you have 2 persons in a room, you have to ask for 2 separate wifi code. I would recommend this hotel as it is more than a 3-star hotel in Roma.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: jelenayork
Reviews.Content: hotel is definitely more that 3 star. Very clean, rooms are mid size and the service was very good. For breakfast we had great choice of cold and hot food, and there was always something different every day. Location - excellent. Close to Termini station if you want to catch a metro or bus. We we going on foot most of the time, and for a few minutes you are at Republica Square, Via Nazionale... We find only one good restaurant in the area (african), but there are few take away with good pizza and pasta. Definitely will be coming back next time I'm in Rome

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: bugsndaffy
Reviews.Content: Just come back from a 4 day stay here, the hotel was brilliant, location was just around from the termini and within walking distance to most attractions(if u dont mind walking). The staff were friendly, rooms were nice, the breakfast was great, lots to choose from. Will stay here again when i next go to rome.

Reviews.Title: “excellent choise”
Reviews.Author: demmytheo
Reviews.Content: this hotel is more than a tree star hotel and the price was 200 euros for 5 nights.breakfast was perfect,many things to choose,the location was near to all transport means like metro and buses.You could easily walk to many places by foot.Many restaurants in the area.The room as big ,clean and the service was perfect.i will go back for sure,i was very happy with this choise!!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Place!”
Reviews.Author: Zufuhrstr
Reviews.Content: From the first time you step your foot on the hotel you'll realise that this hotel deserves more than the 3 stars it has! The personel is very friendly and they'll try their best to please you! The location of the hotel near "Termini" the central Metro station of Rome, will ensure that you're access to any place you want to go, from the Fiumincino airport till the "Fontana Di Trevi", even though almost everything is in a walking distance. Breakfast at the hotel is great and you'll enjoy it all the way! Plenty and various food. Staff will make sure you'll have what you need! Wi-Fi internet it's free, but make sure to ask for a new code every day due to a daily change. A really great value for money! This is definitely the place to stay in Rome if your budget is limited!!!

Reviews.Title: “Not bad”
Reviews.Author: fincontroller
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in the old building in the center of Rome near the railway station Termini. The staff was very helpfull and very good. The breakfast was good too. They offered sausages, boiled eggs, rice, pork and cheese. The rooms were very dark because of the sun blinds and many curtains on the windows. The air conditioner was so dirty, that pieces of black mud hanged on it and on ventillation holes. It was difficult to sleep at night, because 50% of the hotel's windows have a view on the narrow street and the restaurant (on the opposite side), where visitors were noisy from 1am till 3 am. Though there were some minuses in the hotel, I would stay in this hotel again, because it was a good value for money (I booked the hotel through Greenline - italian touroperator) and not bad overall.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: sofiageorgiou
Reviews.Content: I always ignore negative reviews because they usually come from negative people. This is my first review ever and I especially wanted to take the time to say that the Andreotti Hotel in Rome was so lovely. Great location to see the city and for transport links too. The staff were so pleasant and accomodating. I want to make a special mention about Roberto from the dining. He took care of the breakfast buffet. He was so amazing, always making sure everyone was happy and making an effort over and above his duties, so that the guests were happy with their breakfast. I've never known someone to take so much pride and dedication in laying out the BEST continental breakfast ever. Everything you can ask for in a breakfast was provided and extended to more than just a breakfast.. Roberto put so much passion and enthusiasm into displaying a heartwarming breakfast. I was impressed. The beds were sooo comfortable and the hotel was so charming and traditional. Over and above average. You really felt like you were in Rome. Well priced too.Okay enough - just stay there - you will love it.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Rome”
Reviews.Author: Jean A
Reviews.Content: We were a party of 10 staying at the hotel in Oct 2011. We chose the hotel because of its proximity to the Termini and bus station. We had a great stay in Rome and the hotel staff were friendly, efficient and helpful. The rooms were cleaned every day and the buffet breakfast was more than adequate and catered for varied tastes. There were also lots of restaurants close by which, after a hard day of site seeing, was very handy. The showers were a little 'cosy'. The prices at the bar were also very reasonable. Overall all of us thought that this hotel was first rate and we would recommend it to any of our friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel with lots of character, close to public transport”
Reviews.Author: Stephanie N
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5nights in sept 2011. We loved Rome and everything it has to offer,The weather not to hot at this time of year, a comfortable heat. The hotel Andreotti is a nice hotel in a quiet safe area in the centre of Rome, The hotel staff were nice people especially Roberto we met him in the bar on the ground floor of the hotel and he was very friendly, throughout our stay everyone was very nice saying hello and afternoon.The maid service was excellent the room was 100% everyday. Pictures on there website and on here are a perfect picture to the rooms our was exactly what they make it out to be. Wonderful! Pro's- Near stations to get around easy, near great restaurants and supermarkets, safe area, Friendly people,Nice decor and comfortable room Con's- Sometimes Noise at night due to people talking outside takeaways outside the hotel,we were situated on the first floor. This is not the hotel's fault in any way it was late about 2am and because it was only people having a great time and a chat we didn't complain, I would say if you are unhappy with the noise at night then I am sure the hotel would do there best to relocate you. Air con was a little loud for me to get so sleep but after a busy day of sight seeing I soon fell asleep Wished there were some English channels on the TV for the early mornings and late evenings, even though there were some rented movies they were a little pricey but you do get to keep them for 24hours. Shower was a little small but adequate enough Con's are little things but I found them difficult sometimes, just needed little home comforts Over all a lovely hotel and I have already suggested Hotel Andreotti to my parents who plan to go to Rome next summer. I WOULD RECOMMEND!!

Reviews.Title: “Not if you want to sleep”
Reviews.Author: Me1978
Reviews.Content: crappy smelly rooms. working outside the window at 7 an on a saturday (!). and a strange reaction from reception that as the work is not in the hotel its not their responsibility Avoid, even if thris is the last one in rome

Reviews.Title: “No Deluxe Rooms here”
Reviews.Author: Dawnie444
Reviews.Content: BE WARNED, Do NOT book a Deluxe room as you will be given a standard room and be expected to pay the Deluxe room price quoted at the time of booking. We checked in with Tommaso on reception and he tried to deceive us with this scam. Upon entering the room [215] allocated to us, I immediately realised it was not what I had originally booked. Without unpacking, I returned to the reception with my booking confirmation of a very spacious Deluxe room to ask if there had been a mistake.I was told by Tommaso that all the rooms were the same.He even showed me other rooms, all standard of course. I asked where were the Deluxe rooms as depicted on the internet as the rooms shown to me bared no resemblance, once again I was told that all the rooms are the same. There appeared little I could do but accept the room that I had been allocated. The tea & coffee making facilities advertised consisted of a kettle & plastic cups! The hotel itself is clean and the other staff seemed polite. Upon checkout, I established that room 215 is in fact a standard room.I asked if I could pay a standard room price.The member of staff on duty was helpful & called the manageress for advice. I was offered a reduction of 20 Euros a night which I had to accept to avoid unnecessary upset for my mother and the fact that we had a plane to catch. I happened to see Tommaso when leaving the hotel and told him that I would be writing on the internet to inform other travellers of his dishonesty and I believe that of the management. And so I have! Rome was however wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rouzbeh
Reviews.Content: We have spent four nights in this hotel. Very good hotel. Nice location. Close to Termini and bus stations. Very friendly staffs. Nice service. Nice breakfast. nice price. Very clean and beautiful room.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, cheap hotel for short stay”
Reviews.Author: ellinika
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is very good, 5 minutes' walk from Termini stration. When arriving in Rome by plane (in Fiumicino airport), take the shuttle bus cross Terminal 3, it's only 8 euros/person to take you to Rome. The Termini station is the final stop. TIP 1: Find the exact location of the hotel on maps on the net, so you won't miss it. The hotel looks recently renovated, the inside looks just like the interior of a castel. I liked it. No heating system, just the conditioned air (a whole system inside the hotel, you can't raise the temperature of your room yourself!). The single rooms of this hotel are pretty small and the bathrooms are pretty small as well. I had no enough space in the shower to wash myself. It was pretty cold in my room, only when a group of Italian children arrived in the hotel and stayed over the week-end, my room was at last properly heated. TIP 2: The hotel offers a very good shampoo (and bath foam). It makes your hair smooth and silky! The breakfast consists of a large variety of food. TIP 3, for eating out: Eat your lunch and dinner in Termini station (go upstairs), at Autogrill's. The prices are very reasonable, and... THE 'COPERTA' COSTS ZERO EURO!!! Large plate with pasta (looked like for 2 persons) only 3 euros! You'll find VERY good pasta there. Plus, many other dishes: meat, pizza, salads, sweets, fruits... at very reasonable prices! Plus, the place looks very clean. TIP 4 for the shopping: Inside the Termini station (right next to the first train line!), there is a good shop at reasonable prices: they provide discounts for week-ends, even 30% for cloths, cosmetics, toys... The hotel is very close to Rome attractions. TIP 5: Take a hop on-hop off bus and go arond Rome. It's the best way to see this city! I took such a bus and it costed me just 8 euros/person/day. All those busses stop at the Vatican city and close to Termini station. TIP 6: If you intend to visit many museums, the price for the entering tickets is very high, as Rome is not a cheap city! If you think about going shopping in Rome... your credit cards must be very fat! TIP 7: When leaving Rome, to go to the airport (Fiumicino, I had a plane to catch at 2 P.M.), I left the hotel at 9 A.M., and it was a good idea, because it took the bus a lot of time to arrive to the airport. Plus, the airport is very big, so I needed time to get to know where my flight was! Overall, I would recommand this hotel for everyone who wants to go to Rome for visiting in extra-season (perhaps not exactly during winter, it was cold when I was there) for short stays.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny rooms”
Reviews.Author: DotMiami
Reviews.Content: Hotel Andreotti is conveniently located just 10 minute walk from the main Termini train station. The room we stayed was really tiny, but because the ceiling was high it did not feel claustrophobic. It looked like the room was redecorated not too long ago, as everything was clean and in good working order. Our room was on quiet side street and there was no noise from the hallway or nearby rooms. The breakfast was one of the best I have seen in Italy. There was an ample selection of deli meats, cheese, pastries, cereals, bacon and eggs and of course coffee, cappuccino, juice. The hotel had a lovely 'living room' downstairs with some books, brochures, magazines and newspapers and a bar. The hotel staff was friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: opoce
Reviews.Content: Me and my girlfriend stayed in a double standard. Well, I definitely have a different idea of the word standard in a 3-star hotel. In brief – an extremely tiny shower corner with black stuff in the outer construction, stained and peeling-off paint in the bathroom, stained upholstery in the room, air-conditioning not working after midnight (you either boil yourself or open the window to the noisy yard), a very noisy mini bar fridge (either plug it out or use ear plugs). On the other hand breakfast was satisfactory (though the dining space is limited and sometimes people had to wait outside). All in all, the room served its basic purpose so so but the quality is far below a 3-star standard and it wasn’t worth the money paid.

Reviews.Title: “excellent,clean,great location and value for money”
Reviews.Author: shazza444
Reviews.Content: went with a friend,really pleased,room was small but lovely and adequate.It was at back of hotel,so quiet.termini and all routes attractions within easy reach.good place to stay,you can go into the gorgeous madness that is rome and then retreat to somewere quiet.Termini is good for getting your bearings.We were too woman/girls..! and we had no concerns about the area or our safety. At night we were wrecked so we stayed local and ate in restaurants nearby that were fine,good food and reasonable. I would stay iin the Andreotti again and have recommended it to all my friends,it feels homely but sweet.breakfast is perfectly adequate. go,its grand.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: GeorginaJoyce
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Andreotti for 3 nights in March, 2011. The location was great - walkable from the train station. The rooms were comfortable and the breakfast was great. We would certainly stay here again next time we are in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely hotel close to Termini”
Reviews.Author: lovenstone
Reviews.Content: The room was compact, but very comfy. A standard double with a shower room. Room was cleaned daily and fresh towels provided. The room had fabric walls which was a bit unusual, but still it looked lovely. The breakfast was perfectly acceptable and kept us going for most of the day. A short walk to Termini and round the corner from the A line Metro which goes to the Colosseum and the Vatican. Overall I would go back again but may try for a Superior room as I believe they are more spacious and have a bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible services...”
Reviews.Author: sorin123
Reviews.Content: Good location: close to the Termini railway station, metro and bus stations. Nice looking room and hotel interiors; a little minus due to the fact that you can hear almost anything that happens in the next room. Good breakfast. So, normally one would say that the hotel represents good value for money, BUT... On the check-in day (March 26th, 2011) the receptionist was not able to read correctly the voucher containing our reservation and concluded that we have a reservation for 1 night instead of 5. In vain we provided even the reservation reference, he bluntly told us that we either stay for only one night and check-out the next day or do not check-in. No "let us check and come back tomorrow with an answer", nothing of polite nature... Our "luck" was that another receptionist looked more attentively into the reservation list and confirmed that the reservation was for 5 nights. Still, this was nothing in comparison with what happened next... Considering the totally unprofessional way the reservation matter was handled, I insisted for our check-in formalities to be done swiftly and our ID's to be returned expeditiously, not " in one hour or tomorrow morning", as the receptionists claimed that it can be done. This triggered a reaction I have never met before: the first receptionist started to speak in Italian (until that moment the conversation was in English) saying words that I cannot put here. I know a little Italian, so I know what I'm talking about... Unbelievable... Needless to say, neither the prompt return of the ID's nor the friendly behavior of the same personnel the next days did not change the HORRIBLE impression I have about this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “If you're sensitive to strong cleaning agents avoid this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Icefire79
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel was very good, the staff in the reception was very helpful in finding the best way to travel to different sights and the breakfast buffé was OK. However, although we had asked for early check-in only 2 rooms (out of three) were available upon arrival at noon. The rooms were small and stank of strong cleansing agents which gave me clogged sinuses and breathing problems during the nights. One of the rooms hadn't been cleaned properly (ironically the one we had to wait for) and there were used soaps on shower floor. That room also smelled of mildew. The air condition/heating system didn't work properly, in one of the rooms they couldn't lower the temperature and in one of the other they couldn't raise it.

Reviews.Title: “Exellent!”
Reviews.Author: Arvidw
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the hotel for a couple of days and we were very satisfied with the hotel. First class service, cleanliness and a good breakfast are some of the characteristic we will give the hotel. Near to restaurants, train, metro and buses and centrally located to all main attractions we have found our hotel in Rome. We certainly recommend this hotel to all our friends.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice indeed, good service and personal.”
Reviews.Author: CoriT_Bucharest
Reviews.Content: It felt like i was in an old castle, very nice and good looking even a bit old. If i`ll be back in Rome this will be the one i'll go. Close to the Termini, where the bus goes to airport. The room is not that big but not small at all, very nice collors and big bed. Also you can have internet in your room, if no, there is a pc downstairs and pay about 5 euro .

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Billy1268
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Hotel Andreotti for four days and I can say that very I’m satisfied. The rooms are rather small especially the bathroom but the most important is that they are nice and clean, and the maids cleaned and change the towels everyday. If you are tiered and want to go out for a quick good meal there is a restaurant in front of it. The hotel entrance was being refurbished. The hotel itself was nice looking, renovated to look like a renaissance style hotel, and the furniture is beautiful and created a nice atmosphere. I can say that I’m satisfied with this hotel and its good position near Termini Station which gives you an easy access to the entire city. When I'm back in Rome, I would go to Andreotti again.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for a short stay.”
Reviews.Author: PINELights
Reviews.Content: We did not know much what to expect, but we were not disappointed at all. Room was not brand new and could have been a metre wider in every direction, but for Rome it was probably adequate, bathroom would need some upgrading really soon, but otherwise we had a good sleep and breakfast that was included kept us full for half a day walking around town. If you are in Rome you must be prepared to walk and in that sense this hotel is within a reasonable walking distance to most attractions. On the way back there is always an EUR 1 bus ride available.

Reviews.Title: “Nearly perfect hotel...”
Reviews.Author: FamilienJuhl
Reviews.Content: ...the only complaint is, that the hotel is a bit away from the attractions in Rome. Otherwise the hotel is very good. The rooms are nice and clean, the staff is gracious and it´s near the Termini station. If you want to go out for a good meal or to have other information where to go, just ask at the reception.

Reviews.Title: “Don't use safe in the room!!”
Reviews.Author: FilipTongeren
Reviews.Content: Hotel was well situated, near Termini from where you easely can reach all areas in Rome. The rooms are rather small, especially the bathroom, but clean. Enough for a city trip. Breakfast was ok. Unfortenately, we used the safe in the room (programmed with a personal code!!) to put some money in. A day later we found out that part of our money was stolen out of the safe !!! the stolen amount was not substantial enough to involve the police but anyway. This kind of behaviour is not done !!! Reaction of the 'direction' was very poor upon confrontation.

Reviews.Title: “Good for the money”
Reviews.Author: Tero Lehto
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Hotel Andreotti for one week's holiday trip in two rooms, one with a single double bed and the other with two single beds. Both rooms were dark and The hotel is some 5 min walk away from the Termini station which has good connection for buses, trains and metro lines A and B intersecting. So it's very easy and fast to get for example to Vatican for just 1 EUR. A taxi trip close to Trasvere or Ghetto areas cost about 10-12 EUR. The hotel staff will call you a taxi when you need one. Anyway, for those who want to walk, the hotel is a bit far away, 30-45 minutes walk away from the ancient Rome. We walked a little less than one hour to the Colosseum in traffic hours. (Of course, women are window shopping which can slow down your walk.;) The next time I'm going to Rome I'll choose a hotel closer to older areas, maybe Trastevere. Hotel itself was nice looking, kind of renovated to look old. The furniture was a bit mixed without but the atmosphere was still great. Hotel breakfast is continental. We had a couple of juices, coffee, tea, bread, ham and salami, one or two varietys of cheese, some sausage, cake, fruits, yoghurts and so one. Coffee and juice are only available from a a machine, something that's unfortunately becoming more and more common in Italy. Andreotti's staff was very friendly, although they didn't speak English very well. No problems anway. It's worth noting there's a wall-to-wall carpet in hotel rooms and public areas. There was lots of dust in both our rooms. This is not a good hotel for those who are very allergic or have astma. Rooms were quite airless and smelly. You can open the windows, but then you'll get sounds from the nearhy bars etc. If you're not a good sleeper, the backside of the hotel is more quiet than the front. If you're on business, there was an internet connection (Ethernet cable) available at least in hour rooms. One disappointment was that they closed their cery comfortable bar already at 9 pm. We didn't find that nice music or wine bar close to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Ok!”
Reviews.Author: Schmooles
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Andreotti is located from near the train station in Rome. This is what we were looking for. The area around the train station may look like it may be a little unsafe but it was fine and have stayed at other hotels in this area during previous trips to Italy. The hotel Andreotti was clean and the staff was always friendly. The breakfast each morning was great. However, the air conditioning was just not up to par during our trip. The staff informed us the air conditioning doesn't turn on until 2 o'clock pm but sometimes didn't turn on closer to 5pm. It also was suppose to stay on until 6:30am but on different occasions it shut off at 4:30am and other time at 5:30am. It makes for getting ready in the morning and relaxing in the evening very hot especially in summer even with the windows open.

Reviews.Title: “Love the Andreotti!!”
Reviews.Author: dhp44
Reviews.Content: I made the decision to stay at the Andreotti for my first trip to Rome with a friend. It's a daunting task to say the least about where to stay when you've never been there. But between reviews, locations, cost, etc. we chose the Andreotti. Afterward, I was a bit hesitant when reading about the Termini area of Rome and knowing that this was close to that area. Well, let me say that it was an amazing experience all around. From the moment we arrived at the hotel, we were greeted with classic Italian charm and warmth. And it didn't stop the entire time we were there. Breakfast was amazing (AND included) in the way of fresh juices, coffees, milk, water, pastries, bread, meats, eggs, cereal, yogurt....you name it, it was there and it was fresh and good. Any and all questions were greeted at the front desk and everyone was in a good mood and willing to help offer suggestions and tips. The room itself was small (but average in compared to rome standards) but very clean and presentable. And kept so daily by the maids. The insides are classic rome....very well laid out and very nice detail at all turns, including the stairs, lobby, breakfast room and bar. Clean at all times, quiet, tucked away off an alley of sorts. If you're going to Rome, GO FOR THE ANDREOTTI. I'm not kidding. After being there and staying in two hotels as a first timer, the Termini area is awesome. Sure, there are some parts that seem sketchy, but you can say that about any large city's subway system. The best part? Termini is THE crossroads of Rome to go north or south cheaply and conveniently. With the dollar so low and euro so high, the subway is basically a free ride to wherever you want to go and quickly. For about 16 euros, you can ride buses and subway ALL WEEK. And that, my friends, is a STEAL. The Andreotti was safe (literally, a safe in the room and attentive desk workers), charming, clean and cozy. Do not hesitate...take the word of someone who was searching feverishly for all of these qualities as a first time visitor to rome. We made a brilliant choice and will definitely stay there again if we go back. Even paying the bill upon checking out was a pleasure and a bit sad to say goodbye. The entire staff of the Andreotti is to be praised for the helpfullness and the good moods that they display at all times. Amazing hotel, food and staff.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Stuart&AnneMarie
Reviews.Content: The hotel benefits from an excellent location. Literally a 5 minute walk from the Termini Station, which gives you access to Metro Lines A & B. Small, friendly, atmospheric hotel. Helpful reception staff who speak good English. Rooms are compact, but well equiped and spotless. Continental breakfast includes fresh fruit, pastries and cold meats. Only negative aspect of this hotel is the bar closes around 9.30pm, but don't be apprehensive to visit the 'Snack Bar' accross the road, as we were made to feel welcome on our daily visit. There is also a selection of local restaurants in the vicinity of the hotel. Ask the reception staff for details.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly peaceful”
Reviews.Author: Romaroma
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 nights in April. Single rooms are always a bit on the poor cousin side, but this one was decorated in a tasteful way. The room was incredibly quiet - no plumbing noises, no footsteps, no traffic. I couldn't believe I was only 5 minutes walk from the station. The breakfast was excellent, and the front desk helpful. It was a good start to my holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly but a bit far from the action”
Reviews.Author: Andycat17
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Andreotti for 5 nights - booked through Thomson City breaks. The staff were very helpful and friendly. The room was a bit dark (heavy wall paper!) and the bathroom quite compact - one problem that kept re-occuring was the lack of hot water ... however, as it was August we were quite glad of a cold shower at times! Unfortunately the area surrounding the hotel is not brilliant and there are only the odd one or two restaurants in the area that we found ... many are also closed in August so beware. I plan to return to Rome this year but will not be staying here - mainly due to its location.

Reviews.Title: “OK, rough neighborhood, no airconditioning”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Hotel is nice and located near the Metro Station (line B). Although you will more than likely have some difficulty in communicating with the staff you will manage to get your point accross. Rooms are clean and nice but small (like everywhere). Bathrooms often with showers only. Rooms are equiped with a trouser press, steam iron (in the bathroom, very uncomfortable location), small frigde (with ridiculously expensive snacks and sodas so better stay away), etc - overall comfortable. I stayed there in May - it was already very hot and the air conditioning was not working so remember that when you are planning to stay there in the summer. You may want to leave the windows open but then you will have to disregard the loud italian conversations from the streets and local bars/restaurants and very noisy garbage trucks (around 5am). Breakfast can be described as continental with some extras such as boiled eggs, ham, cheese, salami and cakes. The hotel was nice but I would look for something different the next time maybe in a more quiet and safe neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “ok”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: hotel ok, management very helpful and friendly. mattresses on bed were very old and we came home bitten to death. not worth a 3t plus a 2t would be more realistic.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Andreotti Hotel for 6 nights in October 2004. I found the hotel very nice, rooms might be a little on the small side compared to Irish standards but they still have everthing one would need. Very clean and well kept hotel. The outstanding feature in this hotel is the friendleness of the staff and their willingness to help us at any time of day or night! The hotel also features a lovely lobby area which idea for hanging around or spending a few hours reading / relaxing. I would recommend the Andreotti hotel without hesitation to anyone! Carmel Breen Ireland.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My friend and I loved this hotel. It was recommended to us by someone else and we more or less knew what to expect. The ambiance of our room and the hotel in general was a lot better then we have supposed. Very clean. Friendly staff. Adequate breakfast. It doesn’t look very presentable from the outside but once you come inside you’ll be charmed. AND it doesn’t have that cheap and nasty smell you get from some of the 3-star hotels. A bit far to walk to the major city centre attractions but public transport is near by.

Reviews.Title: “A good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Nalin_9
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 4 nights at the Andreotti. It was clean and comfortable. The continental breakfast was good. The hotel is in a quiet neighborhood in the heart of Rome, walking distance to the Metro, the central bus station and the main railway station. One can take the double decker tourist bus with an open top from this area and get off at various monuments, and get back on another bus after visiting the monument, one can do this as many times as one likes for one daily fee. The front office staff were very fluent in English and very helpful. There are great little restaurants with side walk cafes close to the hotel. The US dollar does not go very far as things are rather expensive lunch for two cost us 30 Euros about 38 dollars and dinner with wine just about 80 dollars. If you buy goods for more than 150 Euros at any one store you maybe eligible for a 20% VAT refund if you are not a ECC resident. Overall, the Andreotti is a great deal for the money.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Andreotti
HotelInfo.Address: Via Castelfidardo, 55, 00185 Rome, Italy
